metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20179 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - high
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in pki-core. An attacker who has successfully compromiseda key could use this flaw to renew the corresponding certificate over andover again, as long as it is not explicitly revoked. The highest threatfrom this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20179` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dogtag-pki - 10.10.2-2
dogtag-pki-console-theme - 10.10.2-2
dogtag-pki-server-theme - 10.10.2-2
pki-base - 10.10.2-2
pki-base-java - 10.10.2-2
pki-ca - 10.10.2-2
pki-console - 10.10.2-2
pki-javadoc - 10.10.2-2
pki-kra - 10.10.2-2
pki-ocsp - 10.10.2-2
pki-server - 10.10.2-2
pki-tks - 10.10.2-2
pki-tools - 10.10.2-2
pki-tps - 10.10.2-2
python3-pki-base - 10.10.2-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dogtag-pki package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.10.2-2').
